title: Karaage Bento with Lemon
description: Crispy Japanese-style fried chicken (karaage) marinated in ginger, garlic, and soy, served with steamed rice, pickled cucumber, a wedge of fresh lemon and a simple tamago-style rolled omelet. Bright citrus and savory umami balance the crunchy texture for an ideal packed lunch or quick dinner.

ingredients.display_name: boneless skin-on chicken thighs, cut into 4-5 cm pieces
ingredients.notes: trim excess fat, cut into bite-sized pieces

ingredients.display_name: sake (cooking wine) or dry white wine

ingredients.notes: sweet rice wine (can substitute with 1 tsp sugar + water)

ingredients.display_name: neutral oil for deep frying (vegetable or canola)
ingredients.notes: amount for deep frying in a medium pot

ingredients.display_name: neutral oil or butter for pan
ingredients.notes: for tamagoyaki and small pan searing

ingredients.display_name: cucumber, thinly sliced and lightly salted (quick pickle)
ingredients.notes: slice into rounds and toss with a pinch salt and 1 tsp rice vinegar

steps.text: Prep and measure ingredients: cut chicken into bite-sized pieces, grate ginger and garlic, measure marinades and starches, rinse rice. Lay out bowls for dredging and frying.

Marinate chicken: combine ginger, garlic, soy sauce, sake, mirin, sugar, salt and pepper in a bowl, add chicken, mix well, cover and refrigerate to marinate for at least 20 minutes (can go up to 1 hour).
While chicken marinates, cook rice: add rinsed rice and measured water to a rice cooker or pot, bring to a boil then simmer until water is absorbed; rest covered for 10 minutes before fluffing.

Prepare tamagoyaki filling: beat eggs with a small amount of soy and sugar, heat a small rectangular or nonstick pan over medium-low, oil lightly and cook in thin layers, rolling each cooked layer to form a log; repeat until eggs are used, then remove and slice.

Heat oil for frying to 170°C (approx medium-high) in a deep pot. While oil heats, dredge marinated chicken pieces in potato starch (optionally mixed with cornstarch) to coat evenly, shaking off excess.
First fry (blanch): Fry chicken in batches without overcrowding for 2.5–3 minutes until edges set and color is light golden; remove to a wire rack or tray to rest for 3–4 minutes.
Increase oil temperature to 190°C (approx high). Second fry: return rested pieces in batches and fry for 1–2 minutes until deep golden and very crispy; drain on paper or rack.
Quick pickled cucumber: toss sliced cucumber with a pinch of salt and 1 tsp rice vinegar (or sugar) and let sit while other components finish, then squeeze excess moisture.
Assemble bento: divide rice between boxes, arrange karaage, tamagoyaki slices, pickled cucumber, lemon wedge, and optional small container of mayo; garnish with sliced scallions.
